translations.translation: He said, 'I am someone who detests the deed you perpetrate.
(Lot) said: "I am disgusted with your actions,"
He said: "I am one of those who abhor your practice.
He said, "I certainly hate what you practice.
He said, “I am disgusted with your works.”
He said: "I am indeed of those who disapprove with severe anger and fury your behavior."
He said: Surely I am of those who utterly abhor your doing;
He said, 'Truly I am a detester of what you do.
He said: I am in truth of those who hate your conduct.
He said, "I am one of those who abhors your ways.
He said: verily I am of those who abhor your work.
He said, ‘Indeed I detest your conduct.’
He said: "I do detest your doings."
He said: "I am, indeed, of those who disapprove with severe anger and fury your (this evil) action (of sodomy).
He said: 'Truly, I am a detester of what you do'
He said, “I certainly deplore your conduct.”
He said, "Indeed, I am, toward your deed, of those who detest [it].
[26:168] He, Lot, said, ‘Truly I abhor, I detest, what you do.

commentaries.author: ابن عباس
commentaries.text: قَالَ إِنِّي لِعَمَلِكُمْ مِنَ الْقَالِينَ (168) وكان جواب لوط على وعيدهم جواب مستخفّ بوعيدهم إذ أعاد الإنكار قال : { إني لعملكم من القالين } أي من المبغضين . وقوله : { من القالين } أبلغ في الوصف من أن يقول : إني لِعَمَلكم قاللٍ ، كما تقدم في قوله تعالى : { قال أعوذ بالله أن أكون من الجاهلين } في سورة البقرة ( 67 ) . وذلك أكمل في الجناس لأنه يكون جناساً تامّاً فقد حصل بين { قال } وبين { القالين } جناس مذيَّل ويسمَّى مطرَّفاً .

translations.translation: (He said) Lot said: (I am in truth of those who hate your conduct) your evil conduct.

commentaries.author: زيد بن علي
commentaries.text: وقوله تعالى: { إِنِّي لِعَمَلِكُمْ مِّنَ ٱلْقَالِينَ } معناه من المُبغِضِينَ

translations.translation: And His saying, "Indeed, I am of your work from the haters" means from the enemies.
